title: Brown, Celtics show championship grit in Game 5 win: Takeaways

title: Harvard Law Paid $27 for a Copy of Magna Carta. Surprise! It’s an Original.
description: Two British academics discovered that a “copy” of the medieval text, held in Harvard Law School’s library for 80 years, is one of seven originals dating from 1300.
content:
Bought for $27.50 after World War II, the faint, water stained manuscript in the library of Harvard Law School had attracted relatively little attention since it arrived there in 1946.
That is about to change.

description: Boston won its first game of the series without star Jayson Tatum, who tore his Achilles in Game 4.
content:

title: Months after Missouri voters restored abortion rights, lawmakers put ban back on the ballot
description: Six months after Missouri voters approved an abortion-rights amendment, Republican state lawmakers on Wednesday approved a new referendum that would seek the amendment’s repeal and instead ban most abortions with exceptions for rape an incest.
content: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. — Six months after Missouri voters approved an abortion-rights amendment, Republican state lawmakers on Wednesday approved a new referendum that would seek the amendment’s repeal and instead ban most abortions with exceptions for ... [5078 chars]

description: The Celtics, behind 22 3-pointers and a breakout game from big man Luke Kornet, stayed alive in the NBA postseason, beating the Knicks on Wednesday night in Boston, 127-102.

title: North Cascades climbing accident claims three lives, including Bellevue man
description: Three climbers, Alex Martynenko, Vishnu Irigireddy, and Tim Nguyen, died in North Cascades after a rappelling equipment failure led to a tragic fall.
content:
The victims have been identified as Alex Martynenko, 36, of Bellevue, Vishnu Irigireddy, 48, of Renton, and Tim Nguyen, 63, of Renton.

title: Drug Overdose Deaths Plummeted in 2024, C.D.C. Reports
description: The progress comes as the Trump administration is proposing to cut funding for many programs believed to have contributed to the improvement.
content:
Overdose deaths in the United States fell by nearly 30,000 last year, the government reported on Wednesday, the strongest sign yet that the country is making progress against one of its deadliest, most intractable public health crises.

title: Missouri Lawmakers to Put Abortion on Ballot Again, Seeking Another Ban
description: The state’s Republicans are putting abortion on a ballot question again, seeking to buck the trend of voters siding with abortion rights on ballot measures.
content: In November, Missouri became the first state to overturn a near-total abortion ban by a citizen-sponsored ballot measure. On Wednesday, it became the first state to try to reverse that decision through a ballot question, after the Republican-controll... [828 chars]

description: The 2025-26 NFL schedule is set to be revealed in its entirety on Wednesday, May 14.
